Key Match Events: Ivan Toney equalised with a penalty soon after on his first international start
Youri Tielemans struck in the 11th minute after a mis-hit clearance by England keeper Jordan Pickford
Jude Bellingham struck in stoppage time to earn an impressive England a 2-2 Wembley draw with Belgium
Post-Match Reflections: I knew the rubbish we would've got if we had lost two games on the bounce
We should be winning with all the chances we've made but these are two games that will stand us in good stead. I know people will be negative but we have to take the positives
I'm sure the manager will be happy with how we played
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match between third-ranked England and their fourth-ranked opponents had a completely different feel to Saturday's flat affair
One thing Southgate won't be happy with was the early withdrawal of John Stones, who picked up an adductor injury and was replaced by Joe Gomez
Others: England, sporting a charcoal grey kit, faced Belgium, who wore light blue shirts and brown shorts
The attendance at Wembley Stadium was 80,733
